info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 02 at 8:13PM EDT until July 02 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Henderson County in western North Carolina... Southwestern Polk County in western North Carolina... Northern Greenville County in Upstate South Carolina... Northeastern Pickens County in Upstate South Carolina... * Until 900 PM EDT. * At 813 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 13 miles south of Hendersonville, or 4 miles northeast of Pleasant Ridge State Park, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Slater-Marietta, Tryon, Tigerville, Lake Robinson, Pleasant Ridge State Park, Caesars Head State Park, Jones Gap State Park, Gowensville, North Saluda Reservoir and Glassy Mountain. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
